result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard Norton Claflin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

miscConds.notes:
No contact with the victim of any kind unless permitted by a family court order in Minnesota.
Agent to do a domestic violence assessment and Defendant to follow through with any recommendation from the assessment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard Norton Claflin

records.addlTxt:
8:45 Defendant Richard Norton Claflin in court with attorney Christopher Stephen Petros.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 8:48  Court will break for 15 - 20 minutes.
9:07  Court resumes Attorneys and defendant are present. Other acts evidence -   Application of the greater latitude rule is also reviewed. Using the Sullivan analysis  OSullivan Defendant will plead to the charge      Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def    Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights  DEF PLEADS GUILTY to the charge.   Facts are correct  COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS   The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates defendant guilty of the charge. OSullivan requests probation for 2 years with no expungement allowed.  Conditional jail time   Attorney Petros addresses sentence. Court orders   S/W Probation 2 years.  Cond: No contact with the victim of any kind unless permitted by a family court order in MN. Probation agent to do a domestic violence assessment and follow throught with any recomendations from the assessment.  Court costs   60 days conditional jail time with Huber. Jail sentence is to begin today at 4:00 PM  Appeal rights are given to the defendant.
from Atty Petros to Atty OSullivan's letter of Feb 2,2015 re: other acts evidence and credibility.
to Amend the Complaint filed by Atty OSullivan
filed by Atty OSullivan
from Atty OSullivan re: purpose to offer evidence at this trial regarding context and buttress victim's credibility

2:01 Defendant Richard Norton Claflin in court with attorney Christopher Stephen Petros.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Petros states there is not an agreement and should proceed to trial. Atty OSullivan addresses motion in limines involving silimar incidents and credibility of a witness. 904.04. Decision is held. Court: where does it fit into the Sullivan analysis. Atty OSullivan has until tomorrow to provide cited case to the court and Atty Petros has until the end of the week to respond.

3:46  Defendant Richard Norton Claflin in court.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State moves to quash warrant. Dates have been set for trial and FPT.Court orders warrant quashed.

Final pre-trial at 02-01-2016 01:30 pm.
Jury trial at 02-11-2016 08:30 am.
